title: Untradeable items glitch

properties.name: description
properties.value: The untradeable items glitch was a major glitch that occurred on 23 March 2022. With the release of Guardians of the Rift, there were issues when dropping untradable items. Regardless of where they were dropped, they instantly appeared for other players, enabling them to pick them up. This meant it was possible for a level 3 account to obtain an infernal cape which is otherwise impossible under ordinary circumstances.

content:
The untradeable items glitch was a major glitch that occurred on 23 March 2022. With the release of Guardians of the Rift, there were issues when dropping untradable items. Regardless of where they were dropped, they instantly appeared for other players, enabling them to pick them up. This meant it was possible for a level 3 account to obtain an infernal cape which is otherwise impossible under ordinary circumstances.

Jagex turned the game offline about one hour after the update to perform a rollback.[1][2] The game was brought back online about three hours later after the rollback finished.[3]

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Old School RuneScape's Twitter account. 23 March 2022. (Archived from the original on 8 April 2022.) Old School RuneScape: "The game has been temporarily shut down whilst we investigate reports of bugs regarding untradeable items. We will keep you posted as we're able to! Apologies for the inconvenience."
  2. ^ Jagex. Old School RuneScape's Twitter account. 23 March 2022. (Archived from the original on 8 April 2022.) Old School RuneScape: "Due to the severity of the identified issues, a rollback of the game is required. We'll be going back to just moments before today's update. We apologise for the inconvenience this will cause and we'll share more info as soon as we can."
  3. ^ Jagex. Old School RuneScape's Twitter account. 23 March 2022. (Archived from the original on 8 April 2022.) Old School RuneScape: "📣 We're pleased to announce that the game worlds are slowly coming back online. The team will continue to monitor the situation and update you accordingly. We thank you for your patience during this time. Happy 'Scaping!"
